### PR summary [065230b4f7](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15429/commits/065230b4f76e07974b84c08eae013ab3ae96dd20)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ instance [AddCommGroup R] : AddCommGroup ℍ[R,c₁,c₂]`
`- instance : AddCommGroup ℍ[R,c₁,c₂]`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10278668292/job/28442683824)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10278668292/job/28442684309)
I've cleaned up this file, with finer sections with appropriate typeclasses, and in particular removed this comment.

After this, you have two `R`'s around, one with a `CommRing` instance and the other one without it, and you hope that Lean will pick the right one for the next few statements (which it will, thanks to its internal rules). I would rather have something more robust, like using another letter instead of the new `R`.
You have already sigma and R around, so this line looks wrong.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: backports for leanprover/lean4#4814 (part 17)
